title: When Should You Start Playing Ranked (How Not To Get Placed in Bronze)?
body:
**# of Normal Games**

This is not the best of the indicators, but this is one of the
better ones that you can use to decide whether or not 
you should start playing ranked when you reach level 30.

100-300 games played: I would say play more norms.

300+ games played: you are probably ready.

Tip: If you want to get placed in a rank higher than bronze,
I highly consider waiting until you are very confident.

**Mechanics** 

1v1 mechanics, team fight positioning, and etc..
can get you out of bronze easily or get placed
in a rank higher than bronze.

So if you win 1v1's often during the
laning phase of the game, you should consider
playing ranked.

**'Norms are Too Easy'**

If you feel that you dominate every normal game,
and you want more competitive play, I recommend
ranked.

**When You Stop Being a Little Baby**

Ragers, toxic players, etc.. ruin games period.
If you are one of those, please please please
just. don't. play. ranked. Or even norms.

If you are going to cry about every single thing,
just go play bots or create a custom
and play by yourself.

**In Closing**

You can obviously play as soon as you reach 30,
but following my 'guidelines' will help you rank up
faster and get placed in a higher rank than most ppl.

Feel free to add more if you wish,
and as always
Have Fun and Good Luck :D

replies.body: Should probably also bring up something about being proficient in enough champions for each role (or at least one in each role) and to make sure you won't have any uncontrollable DC problems (like if you have bad internet, probably would be for the best that you don't play). I know these are the reasons I'm not playing ranked.

I always assume whoever plays ranked has stable internet
because I like to believe people are considerate and logical to a 
certain extent.

I would say you don't really NEED to be proficient in every role,
but I'd say you should be pretty good at at least 3 different roles,
maining 1 or 2 since you can always communicate in champ select
for a diff role.

For example, I know a guy who in season 4 played jg 99% of the time
because he would either dodge or beg for the role every time he didn't
get it.

After reaching lvl 30 I played 10 or so games, noticed how much I was matched up with golds and even some platinums. Played my provisionals, went 3-7 due to bad internet connection and ended up in silver V. 

Really though, just jump into ranked and don't care for where you end up. Bronze V is only hell or heaven depending on your mindset. As long as you try to get better, you will rise through the ranks anyways. If you feel you're ranked too low, just play carry champions and learn to carry the game there. 

Being able to play every (or almost every) role and having some champions to choose from is important though if you want to start ranked. And having two runepages is good as well.

You mean extra rune pages? Because everyone has 2 rune pages (and seriously, getting two basic AD and AP pages full with tier 3s should be top priority once you get to level 20. That's what I did, and I just bought the runes whenever I could, so that towards the later levels, I already had the rune I needed for the slot I unlocked)

No I just mean two basic rune pages that are completely filled with either tier 3 or tier 2 (at a stretch) runes. Getting both your basic AP/AD tier 3 rune pages and also a respectable champion pool by lvl 30 isn't always so easy so I thought I'd just mention it.

what about those players that end up in high gold after playing their placement games despite not winning a majority of them? they must of played 1000+ games before playing ranked, but since their MMR is high they automatically get placed in higher division is this true?

There's no MMR when you are unranked :D
It doesn't matter how many norm games you played;
it's mostly dependent upon how many games you win.
On average, winning at least 4 games should place you

What's so bad about being placed in Bronze? I got placed Bronze 4 when I started my ranked career and it was exactly where I deserved to be. Fast forward a couple years of slow improvement and now I'm Plat 3. Bronze is not a bad thing.

I never said bronze was a bad thing.
My title might have implied it, but the whole post
is pretty much for people who do NOT want to get
placed in bronze.

While you are correct, I think the community as a whole needs to "grow up" as far as Bronze is concerned. There is an incredible amount of hate and vitrol that is spewed towards bronze-elo players that they simply don't deserve, and going off of my own personal experience, being seeded into Bronze is not a bad thing. 

Bronze players should be allowed to be bad, allowed to make mistakes, and most importantly should be given the same level of dignity and respect as higher-elo players. Otherwise we're all just creating a very oppressive, shame-filled environment which doesn't belong in this game.

I believe we are of one mind in this.
Regarding champions and roles, I would maybe consider the rule of threes: Have a decent understanding of at least three different champions in three different roles.
Just ask a plat-diamond player to rate you tbh. Usually people of high elo know where people would be, even people who are higher than themselves.

It took me quite a few months to learn how to stop being Toxic, and ignore toxic teammates. It's just something you have to learn, that in order to climb you have to keep the peace. If you feel like you can't go without talking back to your teammate, mute them.
You have an MMR in normals just like ranked. When you start getting 2 gold players on your team regularly, you are probably ready.
No when you can out play the golds you are ready. Plenty of people get matched and fold under,then carried by the team.
That's what I meant. Sorry for the lack of clarification.

upgrade your trinkets at level 9, make sure you almost always have a vision ward on the map, and know how to play at least two roles. If one of them is support you will always get your wish, or better role.
Do you have 2 full rune pages of tier 3 runes? If yes then you are probably ok to play ranked

I would say you're good to play ranked when you have a good grip on what most champion abilities do (how much damage, how large of distance, what additional effects.) and how long most ability cooldowns are.  You need to be able to glance at your minimap often to watch wards for where ganks are coming from, and you need to know when the enemy can finish you off with an ability combo+ignite.  If you can't watch the minimap, you're going to never see the jungle ganks coming.  If you can't measure your opponent's damage, you're going to feed him.
Play it when you're ready. Even if you end up in bronze 5, you'll climb up as you improve.
I recommend in placements not to play one role and one champion repeatedly. You get sloppy after a while.

1. once you reach lvl 30, play ranked only

2. dont bother about your rank. no matter if you are bronze or silver or what, you will learn more from a ranked match than from a normal
